intro: Chrysanthemum leucanthemum var. asperulum, commonly known as the roughleaf whitehead, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It features a rosette of gray-green, rough-textured leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and blooms from late summer into early autumn. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained, fertile soil. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
